item.description:
EVENT: Ipswich River, Mass Audubonâ€™s largest sanctuary, offers more than 10 miles of interconnecting trails that invite you to explore the forests, meadows, wetlands and other landscape features created by a glacier 15,000 years ago. Huge rocks, exotic trees and shrubs that were part of a former arboretum that provide an adventurous walk.

Trip Coordinator: David Goldsmith: dgoldsmith38@aolcom or call 978-740-0345 before 9:30
RSVP: Required by 05/13, use dgoldsmith38@aolcom and include a cell phone number in case we have to get through to you on the 16th.
MEET: 11:00 AM in the sanctuary parking lot located at 87 Perkins Row, Topsfield. Rain will postpone.

From Boston and the south: Take Rt I-95 north to exit 50 and follow Rt 1 North. At the junction of Rt 1 and Rt 97, turn right onto Rt 97S (toward Beverly and Danvers). Follow Rt 97S and take the 3rd left onto Perkins Row. Follow Perkins for 1 Mile and the Sanctuary is on the right.

COST: $4 for nonmember adult Audubon entrance fee; $3 for nonmember children (2-12) plus $5 for a Mosaic guest.

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: Ipswich River Wildlife Sanctuary
